content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find a one-way business class flight from Buenos Aires to Amsterdam on March 10, 2024, and provide the details of the flight with the shortest duration.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/travel/flights/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To start the flight search, I need to set the "Where from?" location to Buenos Aires. The relevant textbox for entering the departure city is [13].
Action: Type [13]; Buenos Aires
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure city is currently set to Toronto. I need to erase "Toronto" and enter "Buenos Aires" to proceed with the task.
Action: Type [13]; Buenos Aires
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure city (Buenos Aires) has been set. Now, I need to enter the destination city, which is Amsterdam, in the "Where to?" textbox.
Action: Type [14]; Amsterdam
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search now shows flights from Buenos Aires to Amsterdam, but the date is set to "Thu, Nov 20 – Thu, Nov 27." I need to update the departure date to March 10, 2024, for a one-way flight.
Action: Click [14]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The date is still set to "Thu, Nov 20 – Thu, Nov 27". I need to update it to a one-way flight on March 10, 2024. Clicking on the date area should allow me to change it.
Action: Click [13]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The travel dates still show "Thu, Nov 20 – Thu, Nov 27" and it's likely a round trip. I need to find the option to change the travel dates and set it to a one-way trip on March 10, 2024. Clicking [14] (dropdown beside the dates) should open the date selector.
Action: Click [14]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar/date selector didn't open in the previous step. The task requires changing the travel date from November to March 10, 2024, and ensuring it is set as a one-way trip. Since [14] didn't work, I'll click on the date range shown near "Amsterdam" to try and open the calendar/date selector.
Action: Click [13]
Confidence: 0.8
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screen hasn't changed; the date is still set to November, and there is no calendar/date picker open. The dropdown button [14] could relate to flight settings, cabin class, or trip type. Selecting [14] may allow changing to "one-way" or access to date selection.
Action: Click [14]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screen remains unchanged and is still showing the previous results with round-trip and incorrect dates. To proceed, it would be helpful to look for an option to change the trip type to "one-way" or a direct way to access the date selector. Since none of the highlighted elements show a date selector, another possible approach is to click on the "Flights" menu at the top [4], which may let me reset the search for a one-way trip and desired date.
Action: Click [4]
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search form is now accessible. It is currently set on "Round trip" and the departure/return dates are still for November. To match the task requirements, I first need to select "Round trip" to change it to "One-way".
Action: Click [12]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The cabin class dropdown is open. The task requires business class, so I need to select "Business" from the menu to proceed with finding the relevant flights.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The class is now set to "Business." The search still displays "Round trip" and the dates are set for November. The next step is to change to "One-way" and set the correct departure date to March 10, 2024. Clicking "Round trip" [10] should provide the option to select "One-way."
Action: Click [10]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6

Thought: The dropdown with trip type options has appeared. To proceed as required, I should select "One way" to update the search for a one-way flight.
Action: Click [12]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7

Thought: The trip type is now set to "One way." However, the departure date is still set for November 20, not March 10, 2024. The next step is to click the departure date input [16] to open the calendar and adjust the travel date.
Action: Click [16]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.75

Thought: The calendar is open but displaying November and December, while I need to select March 10, 2024. I should use the "Next" button [77] to navigate to the correct month.
Action: Click [77]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.8
